Automatic creation of Java archives
Preface
Command line version
Eclipse plugin
Bernd Eggink, monoped@users.sourceforge.net SourceForge project page
Plugin
Usage
Plugin start
Options
Class lookup
File lookup
Directly supplied files
Class lookup
Here you can enter names of classes which are to be looked up and copied to the output archive. After copying, the bytecode of the classes is scanned recursively for other referenced classes. These are copied as well, if not yet contained in the file.
New names are entered in the input field at the right and inserted in the list by clickug on "add". List entries may be deleted by selecting them and clicking on "remove".

Class names may contain wildcards ? and * in their last components. In this case all classes matching the pattern are looked up and inserted. For example, the expression a.b.* will copy all classes belonging to the package a.b.

In many cases it will be sufficient to enter the name of the main class (or one of the main classes). If the project contains more than one, you can select one out of a list which appears after clicking on "Browse for main classes":

Options
File lookup
